title: IDOR on Program Visibilty (Revealed / Concealed) against other team members

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hi HackerOne Team,

**Summary:**

When you are a part of a program security team, you have a choice to show in your profile that you are a member of the sec team, you can also hide it if you don't want to show it to your profile, any team member can do that using your profile settings here: https://hackerone.com/settings/teams > Visibility > Revealed/Concealed.

__Important:__ ONLY YOU can do that to your profile settings, anyone is not allowed to do that, even other member of the security where you belong is not allowed.

However i have found a way to edit the visibility of any co-admin / co-member of the team where i belong using IDOR.

---

**Description (Include Impact):**

When you edit your team visibility the following __graphql__ `POST` request below is belong called.

```
POST /graphql HTTP/1.1
Host: hackerone.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:56.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/56.0
Accept: */*
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
content-type: application/json
x-auth-token: eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJleHAiOjE1MTExMDc2Njd9.h_X6amYP8V-Y0tts_zg2jDudNeqx75fVfS5FZSczq1s----137042
origin: https://hackerone.com
Referer: https://hackerone.com/settings/teams
Content-Length: 574
Cookie: __cfduid=d3f42c3c5af53e3946c559d253a1fb9451511104348; _cfuid=c8d12dfb-fe68-4b32-bd94-d3664f3b9e9b; __Host---6c4b58c006e021c83b8e076370dcdc1efe40a984; app_signed_in=true
DNT: 1
Connection: close

{"query":"mutation Update_team_member_visibility_mutation($input_0:UpdateTeamMemberVisibilityMutationInput!) {\n  updateTeamMemberVisibility(input:$input_0) {\n    clientMutationId,\n    ...F1,\n    ...F2\n  }\n}\nfragment F0 on TeamMember {\n  id,\n  concealed\n}\nfragment F1 on UpdateTeamMemberVisibilityMutationPayload {\n  team_member {\n    id,\n    ...F0\n  }\n}\nfragment F2 on UpdateTeamMemberVisibilityMutationPayload {\n  errors\n}","variables":{"input_0":{"team_member_id":"Z2lkOi8vaGFja2Vyb25lL1RlYW1NZW1iZXIvNDM3OTQ=","concealed":true,"clientMutationId":"1"}}}
```

You will observed these parameters 

```
{
"team_member_id":"Z2lkOi8vaGFja2Vyb25lL1RlYW1NZW1iZXIvNDM3OTQ=",
"concealed":true,
"clientMutationId":"1"
}
```
__team_member_id__ contains base64 value: `Z2lkOi8vaGFja2Vyb25lL1RlYW1NZW1iZXIvNDM3OTQ=` , decoding it will show: `gid://hackerone/TeamMember/43794`

As you can see it will reveal your team member id, on my case it's `43794`

Now changing the value of `43794` to other team member id will result an Insecure Direct Object Reference attack against other team members.

__Vulnerable:__ `gid://hackerone/TeamMember/<victim_team_id_number>`

How to see other all other team members id, you can just simply go here: https://hackerone.com/parrot_sec/team_members.json , all team member id is on the list under `team_member_ids` attribute on the json response.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Login and go to https://hackerone.com/settings/teams > __Visibility__
2. Click Concealed / 	Revealed to manipulate showing or hiding it in your profile.
3. Capture the request using burp (please see the graphql POST request above)
4. Decode the value of base64: "team_member_id":"Z2lkOi8vaGFja2Vyb25lL1RlYW1NZW1iZXIvNDM3OTQ=" > `gid://hackerone/TeamMember/<team_member_id>`
5. Change the value of `<team_member_id>` to victims team member id (other team member)
6. Forward the request, your co-team member profile settings will be edited.

__NOTE:__ I ask permission to my friend which is member if parrot sec, I used this test profile https://hackerone.com/parrotsec1 to perform IDOR against this other team member profile: https://hackerone.com/phspade , both are team members of parrot sec. I successfully remove the public __Teams__ visibility of other team member @phspade without user interaction.

Let me know if anything else is needed.

Regards
@pinoywhitehat

activities.message:
Hi @pinoywhitehat,
Thank you for the report. We are reviewing this currently and will get back to you soon regarding this. 
Thanks!
@rockyrobot

It looks like this only works because the other user is a member of another team you are an administrator of. Thereby giving you legitimate access to change the team's visibility for that user, if I understand correctly. Can you reproduce this for a user you are not an administrator of?

Hi @philip 

>It looks like this only works because the other user is a member of another team you are an administrator of.

You are correct on the above statement, however the next statement seems wrong:

>Thereby giving you legitimate access to change the team's visibility for that user, if I understand correctly.

You are wrong, even team administrator should not have legitimate access to other user member settings __because it is own user settings under the user profile: https://hackerone.com/settings/teams__ and __NOT__ belong to program user management settings here: __https://hackerone.com/<program_handle>/team_members__

So even if you are an administrator of a program, you will not be able to change the visibility of other user member, because there is no settings for that on the program user management.

The only person can change their profile settings is the user itself, when someone are able to change user profile settings, it is a clear IDOR.

Let me know your thoughts.

__NOTE:__ being an administrator of a program as a condition to exploit this can minimize the severity, but changing other user profile settings which you don't have access is a clear vulnerability.

Regards
@pinoywhitehat
@pinoywhitehat I apologize, it appears you are correct! The security impact of this is not that big, but it's worth fixing regardless.

It seems someone ran into the same issue a couple of years ago: #99908. I've invited you to the report and I'm closing this one as a duplicate of that informative report.

As @fern explained in that report:

> Historically, we have always allowed team managers to toggle the visibility of their team members. We recently revamped the settings page and the UI settings for managers to do this were lost. As stated above, we will be making the necessary changes to keep the front and back end in sync by re-adding the UI for managers in the settings page.
Unfortunately, while we can see how you may have thought this was a security vulnerability, this is not an IDOR.

Happy Hacking,

Philip
Note: what is different this time that the API has changed from REST to GraphQL, but it's still the same behavior.

Hi @philip ,

I see, I've read #99908 and it's seems really the same issue aside from __REST API__ vs __GraphQL__ `POST` request.

So it's been 2 years since @fern promises to adjust the UI to avoid confusion of front end vs back end that causes this to look like a valid IDOR:

>As stated above, we will be making the necessary changes to keep the front and back end in sync by re-adding the UI for managers in the settings page.

I think 2 years is reasonable enough to change the UI, while i see the API manage to switch from REST to GraphQL but the UI leave untouched ? :)

Anyways I'd be glad that i have submitted a report that will remind you guys that you have a __pending__ UI changes for 2 years :)

@philip let's fully disclose this to avoid other researcher from submitting the same issue that indeed __looks like a valid idor__ to save both researcher and sec team time and effort for the investigation :)

i think it is fair enough to disclose this, what do you think ?

@pinoywhitehat You're right, that is something we could have done better. Although we re-added the UI for toggling notifications, we did not do so for toggling membership visibility. Thank you for your time and patience, better luck next time!
